p: We found that C. nardus leaves exhibited moderate inhibitory effects on pancreatic lipase and strong lipolysis-enhancing effects. C. nardus leaves have been traditionally used in health products including soaps, anti-mosquito oils, candles, and pain-relieving oils [ 8]. Interestingly, a study by Batubara et al. reported the weight-reducing effects of citronella oil an essential oil extracted from C. nardus which contains R-citronellal, neryl acetate, citronellyl acetate, geraniol, and Î²-citronellol, in obese rats [ 8]. Inhalation of this essential oil led to increased sympathetic nerve activity and decreased appetite, weight gain, and cholesterol levels. The anti-obesogenic effects of consumption of this leaf have not yet been studied.
